An emergency case sends Dr. Pol out on a farm call to treat a horse with choke, while Dr. Brenda has her hands full with pregnancy checks on a herd of rowdy cows.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The Pol‚Äôs welcome a new foal to the family as the warmer spring temperatures turn up the heat on animal emergencies. Dr. Brenda‚Äôs knee snaps while saving the life of a mare. Dr. Pol is called out to treat five calves that are struggling to grow. Dr. Nicole plucks quills from a curious Chihuahua, and Dr. Lisa treats a cat with a blocked bladder.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: It‚Äôs Father‚Äôs Day, and the team is busy as a puppy tornado touches down at the clinic. Dr. Pol treats a peahen with an injured leg as Dr. Lisa performs surgery to repair wounds from a dog fight. Dr. Nicole rescues a kitten on her way into work, and Dr. Brenda discovers multiple abscesses on cat. Away from the clinic, Charles comes up with a plan to help his dad relax and enjoy the holiday.

programme.title: Sharks Up Close With Bertie Gregory
programme.desc: Bertie heads to South Africa for his most dangerous mission yet. The wild waters here are a hotspot for one of the ocean‚Äôs most famous and fearsome predators: the great white shark. Bertie will attempt to film them hunting seals underwater without the use of a protective cage. It‚Äôs highly risky, but filming without the cage is the very best way to see them behaving naturally.

programme.title: Return Of The White Shark
programme.desc: Cape Cod ‚Äî America‚Äôs Playground ‚Äî is a newly emerging hotspot for a top predator. Great Whites are appearing in increasing numbers, when for centuries there were none. Through spectacular imagery, we‚Äôll see how the landscape of Cape Cod has changed over time, and what is luring Great Whites in record numbers.

programme.title: Cannibal Sharks
programme.desc: CANNIBAL SHARKS pulls in two of the world‚Äôs leading shark experts to unpack and analyze the mounting evidence that shark-on-shark attacks happen a lot more than we ever realized. .

programme.title: Backyard Bull Shark
programme.desc: Bull sharks are invading in a big way. Found in oceans worldwide, their bullish behavior has made them famous from coast to coast. And the seven seas aren‚Äôt enough, they‚Äôre taking over brackish waters and rivers, too! Warmer waters due to climate change mean bull sharks can expand their range even further‚Ä¶ so the more we learn about them now, the better.

programme.title: Sharks Of The North
programme.desc: Sightings of great white sharks have been on the rise in Atlantic Canada. Alanna Canaran, a passionate science educator and dive instructor, embarks on a mission to unravel the enigmas surrounding these magnificent creatures and is determined to dispel fear of sharks in Nova Scotians. As the journey unfolds, Canaran and her team dive into the history of human-shark relationships along the coast.

programme.title: Cannibal Sharks
programme.desc: CANNIBAL SHARKS pulls in two of the world‚Äôs leading shark experts to unpack and analyze the mounting evidence that shark-on-shark attacks happen a lot more than we ever realized. .

programme.title: Wild Hunters
programme.desc: Bears are among the most supreme predators on Earth. The turning of the seasons provokes profound changes in bears' bodies, allowing them to endure the harshest conditions. .

programme.title: Wild Hunters
programme.desc: When on the hunt, snakes judge to perfection the very instant that separates life from death. Venomous snakes are one of the most lethal animals on the planet. .

programme.title: Sharks Of The North
programme.desc: Sightings of great white sharks have been on the rise in Atlantic Canada. As the journey unfolds, Canaran and her team dive into the history of human-shark relationships along the coast.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin journeys down Australia‚Äôs rivers to find which riparian animal is most built to survive. His first encounter is with the duck-billed platypus, a peculiar and adorable monotreme, or egg-laying mammal. Phil then gets a grip on the ultra-slimy long-finned eel and learns of its extraordinary reproductive habits before finally catching a river-dwelling bull shark.

programme.title: The Incredible Honey Badger
programme.desc: Honey badgers live a life of fearless confrontation. From the very beginning, they go through nature‚Äôs ultimate boot camp. These small, curious creatures take stings from scorpions and endure swarms of angry bees‚Äîall lessons that strengthen them against far more lethal threats. Over time, they develop an almost supernatural resilience to venom and pain. Honey badgers take on predators many times their size, from lions to leopards.

programme.title: America's Wild Spaces
programme.desc: National Geographic Television joins a rare scientific odyssey to explore the Canyon's entire 277-mile length and examine its mysteries.

programme.title: America's Wild Spaces
programme.desc: Journey with JT Reynolds, Death Valley's larger-than-life superintendent, and meet the scientists who are working to protect this wild place as the mercury rises.

programme.title: Kingdom Of The Polar Bears
programme.desc: Dennis, a bear guide and Churchill local, puts his skills to the ultimate test as he searches the unforgiving Manitoba wilderness for a polar bear den in hopes of capturing the first moments of a cub‚Äôs life in the wild. Meanwhile on the tundra, a pregnant mother bear returns to the land where she and her ancestors were born.

programme.title: Jaguars Vs. Crocs
programme.desc: Veteran wildlife photographer Steve Winter and cameraman Bertie Gregory capture the remarkable lives of Jaguars in the Pantanal of Brazil. A mother jaguar teaches her cub survival while a determined male jaguar named Scarface dives headfirst into the river to tackle the deadliest of opponents - 6-foot long caiman. Clever capybaras and playful giant otters stick with their family members to avoid being jaguar dinner.

programme.title: Wild Life: Resurrection Island
programme.desc: National Geographic wildlife filmmaker Bertie Gregory goes on an adventure to the iconic South Georgia Island. This island has one of the highest concentration of wildlife on the planet. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: With an ultrasound for a bearded dragon and wound care for a goose, the to-do list never ends. Dr. Lisa has back-to-back pup emergencies. Dr. Pol and Dr. Brenda team up to answer an emergency farm call, and Dr. Nicole gives TLC to a stray kitty. While the clinic staff takes care of business in MI, Dr. Pol proudly escorts U.S. veterans to Washington, D.C. with the Mid-Michigan Honor Flight.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol treats three bovines and one tiny rabbit before heading to the Netherlands with Diane to celebrate his 80th birthday. Just because the Docs away, it doesnt mean that the clinic slows down. A very vocal pig needs surgery to treat a hernia, a blocked cat is in pain and requires immediate relief, and a puppy is feeling the effects of eating something inedible. .

programme.title: Snow School
programme.desc: When every day is a snow day, school is always in session! Snowy climates can make for harsh living, and adulting is hard no matter where you are, but these young are flourishing; a baby walrus gets a swim lesson from Mom, young stoats‚Äô playtime teaches them how to hunt, otter pups take a slide and learn to avoid predators, and owlets practice leaving the nest.

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The polar bear is the world's largest land predator-but it's born blind and deaf. How does a helpless cub become a successful killer? Built for the Kill: Polar Bear exposes real life and death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. The cub spends about three years at its mother's side, learning to navigate the harsh Arctic environment. .

programme.title: Kingdom Of The Polar Bears
programme.desc: Dennis, a bear guide and Churchill local, puts his skills to the ultimate test as he searches the unforgiving Manitoba wilderness for a polar bear den in hopes of capturing the first moments of a cub‚Äôs life in the wild. Meanwhile on the tundra, a pregnant mother bear returns to the land where she and her ancestors were born.

programme.title: Kingdom Of The Polar Bears
programme.desc: Dennis follows the mother bear and her two cubs by snowmobile as they reach the shores of Hudson Bay at last. As the precarious ice and food shortage threatens mother bear‚Äôs ability to teach her cubs to survive and thrive, the hungry family are confronted with even bigger challenges than before.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how polar bears hunt prey, offering new perspectives on the tactics they use to track, stalk and ambush seals, whales and walruses. We follow a mother fighting to feed her two cubs in the harsh polar extremes, and a young male driven by starvation to tackle enormous prey.

programme.title: Winter Of The Bear
programme.desc: In the forests of northern Finland, survival is a race against the seasons. For a mother brown bear, life between winters is a relentless battle as a single mother. She wakes from hibernation, thin and weary, to guide cubs through a fleeting summer. They need food, and she‚Äôll teach them everything, not least of all, avoiding dangerous males during mating season and facing wolves in a deadly fight for food.

programme.title: Land Of The Iberian Lynx
programme.desc: Sierra Morena is a mountain range of climatic extremes. The harsh winter puts the lynxes of the Jandula River Valley to the test. Golden eagles, otters, wild boars and cormorants struggle to survive in the land of the Iberian lynx.

programme.title: Hostile Planet
programme.desc: Step inside the most frigid habitat known to Earth - the poles. Here, the planet's ultimate survivalists include whale-hunting polar bears, leopard-seal dodging penguins and a pack of Arctic wolves that bring down a pair of musk oxen. Polar species have evolved bodies and behaviours that help them combat the intense hostility of their habitats.
